definition: one divides into two/to be two-sided/there are two sides to everything/to see both sb's good points and shortcomings (idiom)
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
part/share/ingredient/component

to divide/to separate/to distribute/to allocate/to distinguish (good and bad)/part or subdivision/fraction/one tenth (of certain units)/unit of length equivalent to 0.33 cm/minute (unit of time)/minute (angular measurement unit)/a point (in sports or games)/0.01 yuan (unit of money)
variant of 為|为[wei4], because of/for/to
because of/for/to
variant of 為|为[wei2]/as (i.e. in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do
as (in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do/by (in the passive voice)
two/2/(Beijing dialect) stupid

sentences.english: It has been 60 years since the country was divided by the civil war.
sentences.chinese: 自从国内战争这个国家一分为二以来，已经60年了。

sentences.english: I think it should not be divided into only two parts, black and white ones.
sentences.chinese: 我想不应该是一分为二，非黑即白的。

sentences.english: Peter now ordered a counter-charge, splitting the Swedish line in two.
sentences.chinese: 彼得此时命令发起反冲锋，将瑞典军队一分为二。

sentences.english: How was the Roman Empire cut in half?
sentences.chinese: 罗马帝国师如何一分为二的？

sentences.english: Then the king used the sword to cut the dead boy into two halves, right down the spine.
sentences.chinese: 于是大仁慈王就用这把剑将尸体从脊柱那里一分为二。

sentences.english: The at last is bisected by first eight mark of halo of generation.
sentences.chinese: 终于存在经过前八记号的晕的产生一分为二。

sentences.english: One single whip will split the paper in half.
sentences.chinese: 我这一鞭子抽下去，这张纸就一分为二。

sentences.english: If two people only a bowl of rice, will split the one person half.
sentences.chinese: 如果两个人只有一碗饭，就要一分为二一人一半。

sentences.english: There are many people in academia,outside academia, who divide the world essentially into two.
sentences.chinese: 学术界内外，都有很多人，将世界一分为二。

sentences.english: In The Burning Crusade. this translates into a divided Silvermoon.
sentences.chinese: 在燃烧远征中，这被演绎成被一分为二的银月城。

sentences.english: A city of southwest Switzerland located on Lake Geneva and bisected by the Rhone River.
sentences.chinese: 瑞士西南日内瓦湖上的一座城市，被罗讷河一分为二。

sentences.english: Parking spaces in parking garages in Brazil were split in half.
sentences.chinese: 在巴西，停车场的停车位被一分为二。

sentences.english: Our single-celled ancestors reproduced by dividing in two.
sentences.chinese: 我们的单细胞祖先藉著一分为二的分裂方式来繁殖。

sentences.english: It splits the disputed part of the Barents Sea into two equally sized areas.
sentences.chinese: 依据协议，巴伦支海争议海域一分为二。

sentences.english: The split-half method of testing can save a lot of time.
sentences.chinese: 一分为二的测试方法能节省许多时间。

definition: to cut up/to break up
to cut apart/to sever/to separate/to isolate
to cleave/to split open/to spread open (fingers, legs)
to break or cut in two/to sever/to cut off/(fig.) to cut off (a conversation, a flow etc)/to interrupt/(math.) to truncate
as rivers Jing and Wei separate clearly (idiom)/to be entirely different
to cut across/a horizontal cut
to separate
to split up/to divide/to break up/fission/schism
to divide/to separate/partition
curve/arc/arch
horizontal traverse/to cut across/to cross transversally
to cut off/to sever
all split up and in pieces (idiom); disunity (in an organization)/complete lack of unity/to disintegrate/falling apart/to be at sixes and sevens
cruciform/cross shape
(hitting) squarely in the middle/(slicing) across the middle/to hold by the waist
to form a cohesive whole/to fuse together
